thread.title: Big Bash boss Kim McConnie wants to introduce Super Bowl-style entertainment
thread.title_full: Big Bash boss Kim McConnie wants to introduce Super Bowl-style entertainment

posts.author: ELIZA SEWELL
posts.title: Big Bash boss Kim McConnie wants to introduce Super Bowl-style entertainment
posts.text:
info_plus_circle Starc doesn't mind backing up 3:43 
Cricket: Mitchell Starc was stopped at the airport to discuss the second test, saying he is fine to back up and force a follow on December 7th 2017 /display/newscorpaustralia.com/Web/NewsNetwork/Sport news and galleries/Cricket news and galleries/ Starc doesn't mind backing up Big Bash boss Kim McConnie wants to introduce Super Bowl-style entertainment ELIZA SEWELL December 7, 2017 8:19pm SUPER Bowl-style entertainment could feature as part of future Big Bash seasons as the league’s new boss starts to make her mark. Armed with four years’­experience working for PepsiCo on its Super Bowl halftime shows, Kim McConnie took over the Twenty20 competitions two months ago and wants to amp up Australia’s shortest form of cricket. Leading into Saturday’s opening round, where four games will be played across the weekend at North Sydney Oval, and two in Adelaide, McConnie declared she wants to make the Women’s Big Bash League the best women’s sport in the world. She said off-field entertainment was firmly in her sights. “Sport and entertainment are merging, and that’s what people want,” McConnie said. “(You’re) wanting to make sure that when they pay money to come to your event, you really are keeping them glued to their seat. Part of that is great competition, and I think we’re delivering that. media_camera Big Bash chief Kim McConnie says entertainment has a big role to play in Australia’s T20 leagues. Picture: Jay Town “Another part of that is making sure you’re keeping them entertained when the cricketers aren’t out there, and that I think has huge head room. I’m not sure about this year, these type of things take a while in the planning, but I’d love to see some musical acts be integrated more. “I’d love to see a different type of entertainment be built more into the WBBL. We were talking about maybe it’s even movies or TV shows, maybe previewing new episodes and making it more of an open-air cinema-type feel. It could be music, it could be movies, ­entertainment in other forms.” McConnie said Cricket Australia would continue to explore Christmas Day Big Bash and expansion of the competition. “I see Christmas Day as an opportunity for afternoon-evening (games),” she said. “I’m not sure when it’ll happen ... but definitely one of the things I’ve thought is Christmas Day is about celebrating with friends and family, and so is BBL, so I can see some ­natural synergy to at some point, maybe play cricket on Christmas Day.” media_camera The women’s Big Bash can do with more exposure. Picture: Getty Images McConnie can see massive upside in the women’s game and the potential to play more festival-style rounds similar to the opening weekend. “Only 30 per cent of Australians are actually aware that the WBBL exists,” she said. “We’ve got the best women cricketers in the world playing in the WBBL. We need to make sure that more and more people are aware of it.” Brisbane-born McConnie started her career as a sales rep for Smith’s Snack Foods fresh out of university. She quickly rose up the corporate ranks to win a posting at PepsiCo’s head office in New York as head of sports marketing. One of her most memorable experiences was working with Coldplay on the Super Bowl halftime show in 2016. McConnie is keen to use lessons learnt in the US to ­improve the viewing experience for people at games and on the couch. “The T-shirt toss ... they ­actually amended that for TV through augmented reality, and people were able to experience the T-shirt toss from home,” she said.

thread.title: Brisbane Roar waiting on final decision of Avraam Papadopoulos spitting suspension
thread.title_full: Brisbane Roar waiting on final decision of Avraam Papadopoulos spitting suspension

posts.author: MARCO MONTEVERDE
posts.title: Brisbane Roar waiting on final decision of Avraam Papadopoulos spitting suspension
posts.text:
City waving goodbye to Timmy 1:02 Football: Luke Brattan discusses how Tim Cahill's move away from Melbourne City has impacted the players.
December 7th 2017 5 City waving goodbye to Timmy Brisbane Roar Brisbane Roar waiting on final decision of Avraam Papadopoulos spitting suspension MARCO MONTEVERDE, The Courier-Mail December 8, 2017 12:00pm
BRISBANE Roar’s frustrating wait to discover the length of defender Avraam Papadopoulos’s suspension for spitting at Sydney FC striker Matt Simon will end on Friday.
In what has become a farcical situation, the ban has yet to be announced despite it being almost two weeks since the incident took place in Sydney’s 3-1 win over the Roar on November 25.
Both players were sent off, with Simon receiving a one-game ban for retaliation. However, for Papadopoulos and the Roar the matter has dragged on.
Two days after the incident, the match review panel decided to refer the matter to an independent disciplinary and ethics committee.
Papadopoulos faced the committee in Sydney last Friday and expected to discover the length of his ban at the end of the hearing.
SPORT CONFIDENTIAL: Cahill’s big payout to escape City
ACL: Roar schedule takes its toll
media_camera The incident still hasn’t been finalised. (AAP Image/Craig Golding)
However, with the former Greek international receiving an automatic one-game for being shown a red card, the committee didn’t feel the need to rush the decision and “reserved their determination”.
Football Federation Australia and the Roar had expected the length of the ban to be decided on Monday, but the committee has failed to deliver.
It’s understood that with committee chairman John Marshall having volunteered his time, other commitments have led to a delay in settling on the ban length.
While the Roar knew Papadopoulos was not going to be available for Saturday’s clash against Wellington Phoenix at Gold Coast venue Cbus Super Stadium due to the regulation punishment for spitting at a player being six weeks, both the club and player are unhappy about being left in limbo.
“It’s very frustrating for Avraam,” Roar coach John Aloisi said.
“He’s disappointed, he’s embarrassed (for) what he ended up doing, and he just wants to move on from that.
“He can’t move on when they haven’t handed out the amount of games he’s going to get.
“We know that he made a mistake, but we’ve got his back,”
“He’s a great person, great player and he’s got a future still here at this football club.”
media_camera Fahid Ben Khalfallah will be back to face Wellington. (AAP Image/Darren England)
The Roar’s defensive stocks will again be stretched on Saturday, with centre-back Jade North set to miss another week with a groin injury.
It’s likely that makeshift defender Jacob Pepper will again be paired with Daniel Bowles in the heart of Brisbane’s backline.
The pair worked well together last Saturday in the Roar’s 2-0 away win over Western Sydney Wanderers, with Bowles making a triumphant A-League return from a serious knee injury that had sidelined him since February.
Fit-again Fahid Ben Khalfallah was named in an extended Roar squad for Saturday’s clash, but playmaker Brett Holman will miss another week with a calf injury.
Gold Coast-raised Nick D’Agostino is hoping for another starting opportunity in the ongoing absence of Holman.
FIFA set to assist FFA 1:35 Football: FIFA will be assisting the FFA rather than taking over control.
December 7th 2017 5 FIFA set to assist FFA “I haven’t actually played at this stadium, so this will be my first time if I play and I’m definitely looking forward to it,” the 19-year-old D’Agostino said.
“Hopefully a lot of family will be here and hopefully I get some minutes.
Meanwhile, FFA will announce next week whether they will aid the Roar’s AFC Champions League campaign by postponing their January 27 A-League clash with Central Coast Mariners, currently scheduled just three days before a likely game in China against Tainjin Quanjin.
Should the Roar survive their Champions League playoff campaign, they will be in Group E with Jeonbuk Hyundai Motors (South Korea), Kitchee SC (Hong Kong) and one other yet-to-be-determined opponent.

thread.title: Anxiety, bad headaches and jitters. Not sure what to do. Thoughts?
thread.title_full: Anxiety, bad headaches and jitters. Not sure what to do. Thoughts? - Anxiety - MedHelp

posts.title: Anxiety, bad headaches and jitters. Not sure what to do. Thoughts?
posts.text: It's hard to tell timetables from your post, but it sounds like you're seeing a general doc and not a psychiatrist. The drugs you've been put on are beyond belief if the timetable is as it seems. First, wellbutrin isn't an anxiety remedy, it's for depression. It's the most stimulating of all antidepressants, not a good thing for anyone with anxiety as a first resort but particularly not for someone who got anxiety from taking speedy drugs. Then, you say you go stomach problems and instead of changing your diet and trying gentle remedies and relaxation techniques you got put on another drug that just makes things worse if you take it for a lengthy period of time and then, you got put on ibuprofen, which is very hard on the stomach! After that, your doctor told you it was okey dokey to just quit taking the wellbutrin when you should have tapered off of it and got put on the hardest of all the antidepressants to take and stop taking, Paxil, and then apparently were told it was fine to quit that abruptly despite virtually everyone who takes it suffers from bad withdrawal symptoms. You are in medical hell, and you have to get out of it. Again, if this timetable is accurate, you are suffering from being put on the wrong meds, withdrawal from being taken off of them contrary to protocol, and have a doctor who sounds completely incompetent. You badly need a psychpharmacologist to see if you can't get back to some kind of balance, and you absolutely must stop using recreational drugs -- you've made that option go away. And you're taking speedy ones to boot. You need a complete reboot and then you need to get into therapy with someone who specializes in anxiety who can teach you ways of perhaps controlling the fallout from your bad drug experience so you can get off this medication and drug merry-go-round. That's my opinion, anyway, for whatever it's worth.

thread.title: Direct biological effects of fractional ultrapulsed CO 2 laser irradiation on keratinocytes and fibroblasts in human organotypic full-thickness 3D skin models
thread.title_full: Direct biological effects of fractional ultrapulsed CO 2 laser irradiation on keratinocytes and fibroblasts in human organotypic full-thickness 3D skin models

posts.author: Anonymous (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Direct biological effects of fractional ultrapulsed CO 2 laser irradiation on keratinocytes and fibroblasts in human organotypic full-thickness 3D skin models
posts.text:
Abstract Molecular effects of various ablative and non-ablative laser treatments on human skin cells—especially primary effects on epidermal keratinocytes and dermal fibroblasts—are not yet fully understood. We present the first study addressing molecular effects of fractional non-sequential ultrapulsed CO 2 laser treatment using a 3D skin model that allows standardized investigations of time-dependent molecular changes ex vivo. While histological examination was performed to assess morphological changes, we utilized gene expression profiling using microarray and qRT-PCR analyses to identify molecular effects of laser treatment. Irradiated models exhibited dose-dependent morphological changes resulting in an almost complete recovery of the epidermis 5 days after irradiation. On day 5 after laser injury with a laser fluence of 100 mJ/cm 2 , gene array analysis identified an upregulation of genes associated with tissue remodeling and wound healing (e.g., COL12A1 and FGF7), genes that are involved in the immune response (e.g., CXCL12 and CCL8) as well as members of the heat shock protein family (e.g., HSPB3). On the other hand, we detected a downregulation of matrix metalloproteinases (e.g., MMP3), differentiation markers (e.g., LOR and S100A7), and the pro-inflammatory cytokine IL1α.
Overall, our findings substantiate the understanding of time-dependent molecular changes after CO 2 laser treatment. The utilized 3D skin model system proved to be a reliable, accurate, and reproducible tool to explore the effects of various laser settings both on skin morphology and gene expression during wound healing.


http://ift.tt/2AzlrSw

posts.title: Ed Sheeran dominates Apple and Spotify
posts.text: Ed Sheeran dominates Apple and Spotify Danielle McGrane, AAP December 7, 2017 5:01PM It's official, Australia loves Ed Sheeran. The British singer-songwriter, who was announced as the most streamed artist on Spotify just days ago, has also topped Apple's list as the most listened-to artist in Australia on iTunes and Apple Music for 2017. Apple released its annual list of the most popular music in Australia for 2017 on Thursday and revealed that Sheeran's multi-platinum third record / (Divide) which he released in March, is its most listened-to album. He also had the top two songs of the year with Shape of You and Castle on the Hill, which both feature on that album. Taylor Swift made an impressive leap to third spot on the year's charts just a few weeks after the release of her sixth album, reputation. Local artists were a bit further down the list with Melbourne hip-hop artist Illy the first Australian entry on Apple's album charts at 22 with his record Two Degrees, while Peking Duk are the first local artists on the song charts at 19 with their song Stranger. APPLE'S TOP SONGS: 1. Shape of You, Ed Sheeran 2. Castle on the Hill, Ed Sheeran 3. Despacito (Remix) [feat. Justin Bieber], Luis Fonsi & Daddy Yankee 4. Rockabye (feat. thread.title: How Drone Photography Saves Money, Reduces Down Time And Improves Safety On Construction Projects
thread.title_full: How Drone Photography Saves Money, Reduces Down Time And Improves Safety On Construction Projects

posts.author: noreply@blogger.com (SWEET SMILE)
posts.title: How Drone Photography Saves Money, Reduces Down Time And Improves Safety On Construction Projects
posts.text: Home Unlabelled How Drone Photography Saves Money, Reduces Down Time And Improves Safety On Construction Projects How Drone Photography Saves Money, Reduces Down Time And Improves Safety On Construction Projects SWEET SMILE By Emilia Kibbe Just as is the case with so many other fields, the construction industry has not only embraced drone photography, but in many ways, has been improved with it. Throughout the life of a construction project, drone technology has not only made certain aspects easier to do and more economical, but it has also made them more accurate as well. Monetary advantages Among the many benefits of drone technology in the construction industry is their use for inspections. Drones are far more cost effective than using a manned aircraft. They can also complete their work in far less time than a human surveyor. Drones can also collect more data more often. All of this makes using drones easy to use in the progress of a construction project, especially when it comes to evaluating progress and costs. Precise assessments Drones have become the method of choice when it comes to evaluating the progress of most construction projects. Drone photography can be sent to engineers and those in other departments such as accounting to provide inspections during complicated construction projects. Drones eliminate the problem of scheduling an aircraft and a pilot. It can also get exceedingly close to an object. And not only can a drone carry a visual camera, but it can also carry an infrared camera if the need calls for it. All of this allows decision makers to evaluate problem spots and make any needed adjustments in a project. Numerous projects If you think that hiring an aircraft and a pilot can be difficult for one project, try doing the same thing for several construction sites. With a drone, however, these issues become a thing of the past. Not only that, but associated higher costs for insurance and other related matters become non-issues with drones. And on-site representatives don't need to be notified using a drone. Using this machine is much cheaper and more efficient than hiring an aircraft. Just make sure to use a qualified and experienced pilot to handle the machine. About the Author: If you are searching for information about drone photography , come to our web pages today. More details are available at http://www.skyviewpro1.com now.

thread.title: Sharri Markson: Bill Shorten’s week from hell
thread.title_full: Sharri Markson: Bill Shorten’s week from hell

posts.title: Sharri Markson: Bill Shorten’s week from hell
posts.text: Sharri Markson: Bill Shorten’s week from hell The Daily Telegraph December 7, 2017 4:41PM BILL Shorten’s long-held upper-hand over Malcolm Turnbull ended this week. The Labor leader has outmanoeuvred Turnbull on tactics for most of this year, leaving the PM trailing in his wake. But Shorten’s political advantage came to a crash in the final week of Parliament. Camera Icon National Political Editor Sharri Markson. Picture: Supplied Astonishingly, the year ended with a reversal of ­fortunes. The PM’s stocks are up. And Shorten’s are down. Turnbull, who should have harboured concerns over the fate of his leadership just a fortnight ago, has resuscitated his authority. This week, he showed renewed vigour and an energised command over his team. Even his darkest rivals thumped their desks and cheered along with Turnbull as he slayed Shorten in Question Time over his deception on dual citizenship. Rival leadership aspirants have, for now at least, packed away their knives. Unless the government suffers a defeat in Bennelong, Turnbull is no longer heading into a summer of discontent and trepidation. The turnaround is not due to one singular factor. It’s the size of Barnaby Joyce’s victory in New Eng­land, with a sizeable near-12 per cent swing towards him. Camera Icon Artwork: John Tiedemann Picture: News Corp Australia It’s John Howard’s public expression of confidence in Turnbull’s leadership. It’s the improved standing in Newspoll (bearing in mind the result would still be a crushing electoral loss). It’s knocking down the rogue ­Nationals. It’s last night finally legislating gay marriage and ­removing it as a divisive issue in the thorn of the government’s side. It’s being on the front-foot attacking senator Sam Dastyari’s links to Chinese donors . It’s the pay-off of being upfront on dual citizens, with Labor only now sending its potential dual nationals to the High Court. The parliamentary year ends with momentum firmly in the government’s favour and Shorten’s credibility seriously dented. Shorten was successful in persuading the public that his own team had no questions to answer on citizenship. The press gallery swallowed his message, defending Labor figures like Katy Gallagher , when we at The Daily Telegraph revealed she was a likely both a British and Ecuadorean citizen. Camera Icon Opposition Leader Bill Shorten. Picture: AAP Picture: AAP Shorten has a proven ability to cut through that will stand him in good stead through his political career. However, one of his messages that cut through was how watertight Labor’s vetting processes are. Voters couldn’t miss the point, delivered day after day after day, that Labor had better vetting processes than the Liberals. Recall the intimidation tactics by staff when I investigated Katy Gallagher’s citizenship and that of other Labor MPs in a front-page story. I was told my story was “wrong and embarrassing”, “fanciful” and fed the line “this is so f…ing stupid”. This isn’t simply a case of hypocrisy. This will have rocked voters’ trust in Shorten. Perhaps even decimated it. His behaviour was supercilious and against the advice of some within his shadow cabinet. Never mind journalists — voters’ trust in a politician is highly fragile, particularly in our current era of distaste for authority. Camera Icon Senator Katy Gallagher. Picture: Kym Smith Picture: News Corp Australia Shorten’s loss of authenticity comes in stark contrast to Turnbull’s declaration that he’s never broken a promise to voters, which he is reiterating in the context of having ­delivered a same-sex marriage postal plebiscite. Turnbull will for the foreseeable months continue to attack Shorten over his misleading protection racket of foreign MPs in his ranks. Already, Turnbull has privately made the point to colleagues that ­either Shorten lied to voters by saying Labor’s vetting processes were bulletproof when he knew they weren’t, or, if their vetting processes were proper, he lied about David Feeney’s citizenship. Turnbull’s point: either way, Shorten lied. Shorten will need to work hard to regain the faith he has lost with ­voters. A full-blown mea culpa would have helped this week. Instead, he continued to protect his MPs from the scrutiny of the High Court. Camera Icon David Feeney. Picture: Kym Smith Picture: News Corp Australia Turnbull can breathe easy at least until the Bennelong by-election, buoyed by his delivery of gay marriage through the Parliament yesterday — a remarkable achievement for a conservative government — as his attention turns to a reshuffle and creation of a Home Affairs portfolio. The past week in Canberra shows politics is impossible to predict and can change course faster than a twisting tornado. It also shows that for all the skills and experience a politician might bring to the job, it is ultimately ­instinct that gets you through. And this week, Shorten’s was shown to be sorely lacking.

thread.title: Fact check: Did an Alabama church compare Roy Moore to Jesus?
thread.title_full: Fact check: Did an Alabama church compare Roy Moore to Jesus? - CBS News

posts.author: CBS News
posts.title: Fact check: Did an Alabama church compare Roy Moore to Jesus?
posts.text:
CBS News affiliate WHNT , based in Huntsville, Ala., reported Monday that The Living Way Ministries Church, in Opelika, Ala. was facing a torrent of criticism over a church sign that read: 
"They falsely accused Jesus. Vote Roy Moore."
WHNT spoke with the church and verified that it's true the message had in fact appeared on its sign but also said that there were "several people" who held keys to the sign, and it was one of those individuals who had put up the message, and not the pastor. Two days after the message was posted, the pastor asked to have the message taken down, a woman affiliated with the church told WHNT.
Though the sign has reportedly been taken down, the church is facing a social media firestorm, with online users demanding that the church be disallowed from receiving tax exemptions, given that it defied, if briefly, an IRS prohibition against endorsing a political candidate.
This church should lose it's tax exempt status immediately. 
Also - Roy Moore is no Jesus. https://t.co/29FQmNcU4H 
— julieverive (@julieverive) November 30, 2017 Hey, Internal Revenue Service, isn't this still illegal? I'll even do your research for free: Living Way Ministries, 1100 Old Columbus Rd, Opelika, Alabama, EIN # 58-1950158
Posted by Darren Farrington on  Sunday, December 3, 2017 This prohibition, known as the Johnson Amendment, has been part of the tax code since 1954, and it bans non-profit groups from endorsing or opposing political candidates. It was named for Lyndon Johnson, who introduced it while he was a U.S. senator.
President Trump campaigned on repealing the amendment, arguing that it was an issue of free speech for churches. In the tax bill passed by the House, the measure was repealed, but it was not repealed in the Senate bill.

thread.title: Three killed, one cop hurt in separate shootings
thread.title_full: Three killed, one cop hurt in separate shootings

posts.author: Tonya Alanez and Linda Trischitta
posts.title: Three killed, one cop hurt in separate shootings
posts.text:
South Florida cops and deputies fired their weapons in three separate incidents Wednesday afternoon, when in all, three men were killed and one officer was wounded, authorities said.
After threatening suicide, 71-year-old Robert Page engaged in a standoff of about 90 minutes with a Coral Springs SWAT team. At least two officers fired and killed him when he came out of his house carrying a shotgun, said Keyla Concepcion, a spokeswoman for the Broward Sheriff ’s Office, which will handle the investigation.
“Whatever moves he made were threatening to the officers,” Concepcion said.
Police had been at the home the night before the shooting responding to a reported disturbance, Concepcion said. The situation was resolved without incident.
Police returned to the home in the 11200 block of 11th Court about 1 p.m. Wednesday. The shooting happened about 90 minutes later, Concepcion said.
Page’s neighbor across the street, Shermika Lyons, said she thought she heard a gunshot about 2:45 p.m. but convinced herself that it must have been something else.
Her suspicion was confirmed a little later, she said, when she looked outside and saw crime-scene tape draped around her neighbor’s home, police cars lining the street and what looked like soldiers huddled together across from Page’s house.
“And that’s when I knew I did hear a gunshot,” Lyons said. “Absolutely that must have been what it was.”
Lyons said she did not know her neighbor other than to exchange waves when he was in his driveway or yard.
Meanwhile, in Lauderdale Lakes a Broward Sheriff’s deputy shot and killed a man after a “violent struggle” late Wednesday afternoon, the agency said.
Neither the dead man who was shot around 5 p.m. nor the deputy was identified by the sheriff’s office.
The gunfire happened at 3610 NW 21st St. when a deputy called for back-up after “he was confronted by a man who attacked him,” said Veda Coleman-Wright, a spokeswoman for the Broward Sheriff’s Office.
The deputy and the man struggled. “It appeared the deputy was losing the fight,” she said. A distress call was made and back up deputies arrived at the scene.
“One of the deputies who arrived during the scuffle saw something that caused him to fire his gun,” Coleman-Wright said.
Broward Sheriff Fire Rescue took to the shot man to a Fort Lauderdale hospital where he was pronounced dead.
Earlier in the day and further south, a Miami-Dade county officer exchanged gunfire with a suspected shoplifter at a Walmart store. Officer Manuel Gonzalez, 31, was shot multiple times and survived; David Facen, 54, of Miami, did not.
The Florida Department of Law Enforcement is investigating the Miami and Lauderdale Lakes incidents.
Staff writer Linda Trischitta contributed to this report. 
Linda Trischitta , Doug Phillips A Miami-Dade police officer who was wounded multiple times Wednesday during a close range shootout with a suspected shoplifter was able to walk with the support of colleagues into a hospital.
David Facen, 54, of Miami, died in the parking lot of the Walmart Supercenter at Northwest 79th Street...
A Miami-Dade police officer who was wounded multiple times Wednesday during a close range shootout with a suspected shoplifter was able to walk with the support of colleagues into a hospital.
David Facen, 54, of Miami, died in the parking lot of the Walmart Supercenter at Northwest 79th Street...
(Linda Trischitta , Doug Phillips)

thread.title: Race watch: Tony Thomas’s tips and preview for Rosehill Gardens
thread.title_full: Race watch: Tony Thomas’s tips and preview for Rosehill Gardens

posts.author: TONY THOMAS
posts.title: Race watch: Tony Thomas’s tips and preview for Rosehill Gardens
posts.text: Weather: Fine RACE 1: MERRY XMAX ATC MEMBERS HCP (1100m) 12.35pm OVERVIEW: Very hard to go past the topweight in Gongs. Simply left them standing at Canterbury midweeks when she raced away for one of the easiest juvenile wins we’ve seen this season. What was the quality of the runners behind her? Well, third placegetter Perfect Pitch then came out and won strongly at Rosehill last weekend. Still only has 2kg over the limit and looks just too good, despite a slightly awkward draw. Expect a big improvement from Countercurrent, who looked good on debut at Queanbeyan before going south and fighting on behind La Pomme De Pin in the clockwise race at Ballarat. She’s got the ability to stretch these. SPEED MAP: Gongs should cross to take up the running, as she did on debut. Carnina will kick up from the rails as she led in her latest trial. Tempo should be OK. DID YOU KNOW: Reagan is a grandson of the Golden Slipper winner Merlene. SUGGESTED BET: Gongs to win. Take 1 as a standout in trifecta with 2,3,4,6,8 in placings MARKET MOVERS: Gongs $2.30-$2.15 ($500 @ $2.30, $1,000 @ $2.20, $400 @ $2.20) RACE 2: #ATTHERACES PLATE (1400m) 1.15pm OVERVIEW: This will be a big battle of tactics. Reckon Star Sensation can cross and lead here. If she gets the cheap sectionals before the turn, she can sprint and hold on. Big threat. It was impossible to miss the run of Heliosphere on resuming when he charged home for third to Pretty Fast. He was a second-up winner over 1600m last campaign but that was on a heavy track. He will get back in the small field but I don’t think Kerrin McEvoy will let the leaders get too big a break on him. Will be storming home. Poetic Charmer is racing in great heart. Up Trumpz (a little unlucky last start) and Sparky Lad (back to 1400m) have sound claims. SPEED MAP: Star Sensation can cross to lead here as she sat on pace when narrowly beaten last start and this is devoid of a natural leader. Speed could be moderate. DID YOU KNOW: Heliosphere produced a cracking last 200m sectional time of 11.20sec last time out, one of the best of the day. SUGGESTED BET: Quinella 2,4 MARKET MOVERS: No bets or movements of note media_camera Volpe’s last-start win has him well placed to be in contention again. RACE 3: TAB HIGHWAY HCP (1400m) 1.50pm OVERVIEW: I don’t think there will be a lot between Volpe and O’Lordy at the finish. Slight leaning to the latter, especially at better odds. She was very good in storming home to win a Highway here two runs back, admittedly getting all the favours nearer the fence. But then she turned in a gallant effort at Goulburn last-start when trapped wide throughout, very wide on the turn and still running on to be beaten only a length at the finish. Down 2kg here, right at her top and hard to beat. Lot to like about Volpe’s win last start. Would have been a certainty beaten if he hadn’t got the run at the 200m mark and then exploded away here last week. I respect the stable’s decision to bring Divine Unicorn here. SPEED MAP: Gitan, Ribs, Magic Choir and Call The Captain are likely to push forward. Magic Choir can lead from good draw as he found winning form leading last start. Volpe and O’Lordy will get back. DID YOU KNOW: Magic Choir was backed from $5.50 to $3.90 at Scone last start. SUGGESTED BET: Quinella 2,3,4 MARKET MOVERS: Divine Unicorn $3.50-$2.90-$3.10 ($400 @ $3.50, $200 @ $3.20, $360 @ $3) RACE 4: ATC OWNERS BENEFIT CARD HCP (1400m) 2.25pm OVERVIEW: Really liked the way Noire hit the line at Canterbury on resuming. Sat near the tail of the field until the home corner and then charged late to win running away. Is up in class here but also up to an even more favourable trip. Has form around the likes of Savapinski, Test The World and Slow Burn. That’s good enough to win this. Drawn perfectly too. There was no fluke in the win of Positive Problems here a fortnight ago. Did all the work in front and they just couldn’t run her down. Queen Misty was a little unlucky on resuming at Canterbury. SPEED MAP: Positive Problems will take up the running again. Expect Noire and Miss Ballantine to sit a little closer. Pace OK. DID YOU KNOW: Positive Problems (winner) and Miss Ballantine (2nd) were both at $41 last start. SUGGESTED BET: Noire to win MARKET MOVERS: Overstep $11-$6.50 ($200 @ $11 TWICE); Deductions: Star Sensation 23c Win, Diapason 4c Win RACE 5: NATIONAL JOCKEYS TRUST HCP (2000m) 3pm OVERVIEW: Impavido deserves one more chance. Forced to take the field up to the tearaway leader last start and he still looked a winning hope 200m out before finally the effort told. Still only beaten two lengths. Very honest and reckon he will be ridden more patiently this time and saved for one last crack in the straight. Carzoff finished third in the same race after coming home strongly. Rock-hard fit now. Mornington drops in grade. At his top now. SPEED MAP: Lead Choreographer is likely to run to the front but don’t expect the same tearaway tactics. DID YOU KNOW: Gambler’s Blues has only won three of 31 but has finished second 12 times. SUGGESTED BET: Boxed trifecta 2,5,6,10 MARKET MOVERS: Mornington $8-$6.50 ($400 @ $8) media_camera Firsthand looks hard to beat on Saturday. RACE 6: BEANIE FOR BRAIN CANCER HCP (1400m) 3.40pm OVERVIEW: Firsthand is racing in great touch and will appreciate a drop in grade here. Kept chasing right to the line when second to Cabeza De Vaca here three weeks ago. Impressive winning at Randwick before that when he toughed it out right to the wire again. The claim helps him here and drawn to get the nice run off the speed. Flow goes up in class but down in weight and was very good last time. All the better for the effort and drawn to get all the favours. SPEED MAP: Flow looks like leading by default from the inside barrier. Firsthand won’t be away, nor will New Universe, Time To Torque and Voilier. Invinzabeel, Liapari and Savoureux will get back. DID YOU KNOW: Savoureux hasn’t won since January 2016. SUGGESTED BET: Firsthand to win MARKET MOVERS: Firsthand $4.60-$4; Flow $4.60-$3.40-$3.50 ($450 @ $4.60, $333 @ $4.40, $750 @ $4.20, $1,000 @ $4, $1,200 @ $3.80, $1,000 @ $3.60, $270 @ $3.40) Deductions: Zumbelina 13c Win Single Bullet is expected to go forward on Saturday. Picture: AAP RACE 7: MARL HUGHES FOUNDATION HCP (1100m) 4.20pm OVERVIEW: Pretty keen on Guard Of Honour. Always had a stack of ability and ready to show it this preparation. Only beaten a length by Tactical Advantage first-up last campaign and was narrowly beaten by Man From Uncle in G3 grade at Randwick. Has trialled brilliantly for his return and will give this a big shake. Single Bullet is an above-average three-year-old taking on the older horses but will relish the drop in weight, especially after the claim. SPEED MAP: Princefamous will go forward, as will Test The World, Single Bullet and Bon Amis. Speed genuine. DID YOU KNOW: Guard Of Honour broke 33sec for his last 600m in a trial at Beaumont. SUGGESTED BET: 8 to win, saver on 12 MARKET MOVERS: To Excess $11-$9.50 ($5,000 @ $11, $600 e/w @ $11/$3.25); Guard Of Honour $8-$6 ($700 @ $8, $10,000 @ $7) RACE 8: ATC MEMBERSHIP HCP (1200m) 5pm OVERVIEW: Thought the effort of Pipeline first-up was very good. The race developed into a sprint home and he was still able to make up ground on the winner after being slowly away. Slight concern that he stays at 1200m second-up but looks to be enough speed on to see him storming home again. Brave Song is a very smart three-year-old who trialled well at Randwick for his return here. . SPEED MAP: The Hipster likely to roll to the front. Star Reflection will go forward and Balmain Boy will kick up from good draw. DID YOU KNOW: Waitaadwatch has won five of seven on good ground. SUGGESTED BET: 9 to win, save on 15. MARKET MOVERS: No bets or movements of note RACE 9: tab.com.au HCP (1500m) 5.40pm OVERVIEW: Prepared to gamble on Invicta. Got to the centre of the track and ran on strongly to win on the post at Cessnock last start. Warwick Farm winner beating Fortensky when last in work. Right at his top and distance suits. King Darci should get a little give in the ground tomorrow, which will help his chances. SPEED MAP: Carluca likely to take up the running from inside draw. King Darci will be handy and Invicta will get back. DID YOU KNOW: King Darci has had six tries on his home track for only two placings. SUGGESTED BET: Boxed trifecta 1,5,7,13. MARKET MOVERS: No bets or movements of note SMASH HIT FOR CHARITY THE Australian Turf Club, together with Australian Bloodstock, will present a major donation to the Mark Hughes Foundation at Rosheill on Friday courtesy of Japanese import Brave Smash’s third placing in the inaugural $10 million ATC The Everest (1200m) at Randwick on October 14. A cheque for $33,060 will be handed over in between the ATC Beanie For Brain Cancer handicap and the ATC Mark Hughes Foundation Handicap. The figure amounts to 5 per cent of the $800,000 prizemoney earned by Brave Smash in the world’s richest turf race. Meanwhile, patrons at Rosehill Gardens on Saturday will have the chance to receive a free ticket to next year’s Longines Golden Slipper simply by being on course. A special code word will be published in the racebook and displayed on the infield superscreen which allows redemption of one free ticket to the world’s richest race for two-year-olds. McEVOY, AVDULLA JOIN FORCES FOR GOOD CAUSE EVEREST-winning jockey Kerrin McEvoy and Brenton ‘The Gun’ Avdulla will fill the void left by the Hong Kong-based Tommy Berry this Christmas when Racing NSW makes it annual hospital visits. McEvoy and Avdulla will visit the Sydney Children’s Hospital at Westmead and at Randwick distributing gifts purchased with the generous and ongoing support of Racing NSW. JONES BEGINS THE LONG JOURNEY BACK GOOD news coming out of the north this week with injured Lismore Jockey Club secretary manager Scott Jones out of an induced coma and out of intensive care. Scott was reported to be sitting up in bed earlier in the week and actually requested his laptop. It will be a long and challenging road ahead for Scott and everyone in the industry sends their best wishes to him and his family. Let’s hope Garry Kirkup can make a full and speed recovery from his injuries and all the best to his beloved Highly Geared at Rosehill on Saturday. MARE RAISES THE BAR IN EUROPE MARSHA, a one of the best sprinting mares in Europe in recent years, set a new record price for a horse sold at a European auction this week knocked down to Coolmore for $6 million guineas of approximately $AU11.1 million. “She is really something special,’’ Coolmore’s MV Magnier said. INGLIS ROLLS OUT THE TALENT CLOSER to home, Inglis on Thursday released their 2018 Inglis Premier Yearling Sale totally 770 lots of which 339 are BOBS eligible. There are siblings to 88 stakeswinners including Group 1 winners Mongolian Khan, Alinghi, le Romain and Extreme Choice. There are 120 stallions with progeny in the sale led by Written Tycoon on 49, Toronado (44), Zoustar (39) and 20 by Sebring and his son Dissident. Black Caviar was sold at the 2008 Inglis Premier Yearling sale for $210,000.

posts.author: 3 Square Art
posts.title: Meowzy’ Juried Exhibition
posts.text:
3 Square Art – Fort Collins , Colorado, United States Opportunity Description 
U.S. National Deadline: December 31, 2017 – Get crazy with this cat show! Meowzy is a fun show for the month of January that showcase our furry, feline friends. They are loving, friendly, and simply adorable and make excellent art subjects. 
I fondly remember an artist working in residence at my university. He seemingly sole mission was to paint large abstract paintings of cats and lions with bold brush strokes and stunning colors. At the time I thought he was a little crazy, but now I understand his genius and never forgot about his paintings. This memory has become the basis for the theme of this show and a benchmark for the creativity we are after. 
We are looking for all types of works–painting, sculpture, photography, realism and abstraction, and more–works that show off your ability and creativity with your kitties. Small and large formats. Give viewers and collectors a chance to see your most artistic work… The main criteria for selection is creativity and technical ability in the artwork. 
BENEFITS Selected artists for the exhibition receive the following benefits: – Posting to 3SA website and social media platforms – Professional exhibition space and display of artwork – One of top galleries in Northern Colorado (great addition to resume) – Press releases on exhibition sent to 3SA media outlets – Accepted artists will be listed on the 3SA website with work and link to their website 
AWARDS

posts.title: BCI's plea on Bar Council elections to be heard tomorrow: SC | Legal Era
posts.text:
December 07, 2017 BCI's plea on Bar Council elections to be heard tomorrow: SC 
The Bar Council of India (BCI) had filed a petition in the Supreme Court of India, pleading the court to modify one of its orders; where the court had directed all bar councils to hold elections and complete the process by February, 2018.In the order, the court said that if, as per the report of the Central Verification Committee, it is found that the law degree of any advocate is fake, the court shall pass appropriate orders in respect of his enrollment as well as the participation in the elections. In the petition, BCI said that the time granted by Supreme Court to publish the electoral list by November 30, 2017is very short and the state bar councils will face difficulties to hold elections. In the application, BCI said, “The BCI has received calls, e-mails and letters from various states bar councils and they are showing their inability to publish the electoral list by November 30, 2017, due to very short period. The state bar councils have sent letters pointing out the legal and practical difficulties regarding the same and requested the BCI to file an application before this court for modification of its earlier order.” Adding further, the application said, “It is necessary to resolve this dilemma occurred in the proceedings so as to avoid an uncalled embarrassment. Further, it is necessary to clarify this cumbersome situation to the Honorable Supreme Court in the interest of conducting a fair election and to preserve the rights of the voters and the candidates.” Related Post

Well the furnace worked well up to and through our Thanksgiving camping trip and several nights after for my brother who was using the TT as a guest house before and after the trip. thread.title: Acute herpes zoster and post herpetic neuralgia in primary care: a study of diagnosis, treatment and cost
thread.title_full: Acute herpes zoster and post herpetic neuralgia in primary care: a study of diagnosis, treatment and cost

posts.author: Alexandros G. Sfakianakis,Anapafseos 5 Agios Nikolaos 72100 Crete Greece,00306932607174,00302841026182 (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Acute herpes zoster and post herpetic neuralgia in primary care: a study of diagnosis, treatment and cost
posts.text:
Abstract Acute herpes zoster and its complication post herpetic neuralgia represent a significant challenge to primary care physicians in their care of an ageing population of patients. This was a cross-sectional observational study by means of a quantitative survey of 1,000 general practitioners registered in Ireland exploring the frequency of diagnosis, methods of treatment and cost of AHZ and PHN in primary care. We recorded an 18% response rate ( n = 184) with an 83% completion rate ( n = 152/184). 80% of cases of AHZ occurred in patients aged 50 years or more with 81% of study participants encountering cases at a rate of 1–3 patients per month. Famciclovir (37%) and valaciclovir (36%) were the most commonly prescribed antiviral agents. Mild opioids (32%) were the most common analgesic agents used for first line AHZ pain, and pregabalin (37%) the most commonly prescribed analgesic agent for second line AHZ pain. Pregabalin was also the most commonly prescribed analgesic for both first and second line PHN pain (29% and 24%, respectively). The mean per-case direct cost (medication and GP visits) of treating AHZ and PHN in primary care was €195 (range €153–€236) and €201 (range €140–€313), respectively. Based on national sentinel data the estimated annual direct costs of treating AHZ and PHN in primary care is €2,278,196 (range €1,793,399–€2, 763,445). The treatment of AHZ and PHN represents both a significant care and cost burden on primary care resources in Ireland in keeping with other European based studies.


http://ift.tt/2AEd7yV

Basic Example in HTML, elements are nested inside other elements like so

Inner

when an event on an inner element is triggered it affects every outer element as you might have read in the post you linked. This is bubbling. Event flow can be controlled by var element = document.getElementById('inner'); element.addEventListener("event",yourFunction, false); here, false means event flow is from the inner element (on which event is fired) to the outer elements. this is the default in all browsers. to stop bubbling you could use stopPropagation()

thread.title: Ubuntu: can apt do everthing dpkg can?
thread.title_full: Ubuntu: can apt do everthing dpkg can?

posts.author: Lucky Rathore (noreply@blogger.com)
posts.title: Ubuntu: can apt do everthing dpkg can?
posts.text:
Question:
As I understand things apt uses dpkg are there any operations that you can do with dpkg that can't be done with apt? as a new User to Ubuntu server do I need to learn anything about dpkg?

Solution:1
In short, dpkg can do much more than apt-*.
Ubuntu and other Debian derivatives rely on the *.deb package infrastructure.
dpkg 
dpkg is the application that handles the packaging tasks of applications bundled in the *.deb files. You can do anything with it that apt can do, at a lower level. You can search, obtain information, view the files, extract, install, remove, configure, etc. with it.
dselect 
dselect is a curses (terminal gui) frontend for dpkg.
apt 
Apt is the Advanced Packaging Tool. With it you can automate a number of steps you would need to do by hand to obtain the results with dpkg. Apt works with the *.deb packages found in repositories to the point that you may not even know the files are there.
aptitude 
aptitude is a curses (terminal gui) frontend for apt-*.
synaptic 
synaptic is a gtk+ (desktop gui) frontend apt-*.
Notable usage for dpkg : 
dpkg -c - Shows the contents of a deb package.
dpkg -i - Installs a deb package.
dpkg -s - Shows information about the installed package.
dpkg --reconfigure - Runs the configuration dialogs that you saw when installing the package.
Notable usage for apt-get : 
apt-get install - Installs a package from your configured repositories.
apt-get remove - Uninstalls a package.
apt-get update - Updates your cache of packages within your repositories.
apt-get upgrade - Upgrades your installed packages if applicable.
apt-get dist-upgrade - Used to migrate to the latest distribution release.
apt-get autoremove - Uninstalls packages that were not explicitly installed and are not needed.
Notable usage for apt-cache : 
apt-cache search - Searches to see if a specified package is available in your repositories.
apt-cache stats - Gives statistics on repositories in cache.

Solution:2
apt and dpkg perform different but orthogonal tasks. dpkg keeps track of what packages are currently installed, and can install or remove them. apt keeps track of what packages are available and can do things like download a package ( and its dependencies ) and hand them to dpkg to install, or check if there are newer versions of the packages you have installed, download them, and hand them to dpkg to install.
In other words, dpkg handles the low level package management, and apt builds on top of it by adding the concept of an archive that contains packages that you may want to download and install.

Solution:3
AFAIK, apt can't be used to install a package from a .deb file; youâ€™d have to use dpkg -i for that. 
Otherwise, donâ€™t worry about it. If you know your way around apt , by all means use that. If you run into limitations of apt , at least youâ€™ll already know to look into dpkg . :-)

Note:If u also have question or solution just comment us below or mail us on toontricks1994@gmail.com

posts.author: BBmars1128
posts.text: Can't tell you much about Saturday morning traffic condition has I had stopped monitoring since the beginning of the year. From Tropical Inn, if you choose to walk to JB CIQ, Try this : 1. walk in the direction of City Square mall. 2. Walking into the mall and get up to level 3 (air con, more comfortable) 3. The mall is linked to the custom building, look for or ask for Old Town White Coffee or Uniqlo , JB CIQ bridge exit is next to it.. 4. Walk along the bridge, there is only one way traffic here, just follow the crowd 5. Need to just show passport in hand when you see security guard at the end of the last bridge before entering the CIQ building 6. After clearing custom, just go down stair and take any buses that bring you across the causeway. Need to pay bus fare (RM3 for CW buses, or S$1) 7. Alight from bus, clear SG custom. Once cleared. Follow the crowd and walk out of the building. 8. Just a short distance when you exit the building, there is a taxi stand and some 50m away, a bus stop. 9. Look out for signboard indicating buses going to Woodland Interchange. There are several buses going there 10. At interchange, you can walk over to Woodland MRT for further journey. Alternatively, after clearing SG custom, go down stair and wait for bus 950. It will take you all the way to Woodland interchange. ... the difference? You may have to wait for some time depending on frequency of service 950 and the crowd One attraction mentioned in this post 1 Uniqlo Ranked #453 of 844 things to do in Singapore 6 Reviews
